xyz.fsgek.common.security

Interface GekSign


  • @ThreadSafe
public interface GekSign
    Denotes cipher for signature, maybe has a back Signature.

    It is recommended to use method-chaining: 

         byte[] sign = signer.prepare(bytes).key(key).bufferSize(size).sign().doFinal();
     boolean verify = signer.prepare(bytes).key(key).bufferSize(size).verify(sign);
    See Also:
    Signature

      static GekSign getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm, java.lang.String provider)
      Returns new instance of specified algorithm and provider.
      @Nullable java.security.Signature getSignature()
      Returns back Signature if it has, or null if it doesn't have one.

      Prepares for source array.

      Prepares for source stream.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static GekSign getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm)
        Returns new instance of specified algorithm. Returned instance has a back thread-local Signature which supplied with Signature.getInstance(String).
        Parameters:
        algorithm - specified algorithm
        Returns:
        new instance of specified algorithm

      • getInstance

        static GekSign getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm,
                           java.lang.String provider)
        Returns new instance of specified algorithm and provider. Returned instance has a back thread-local Signature which supplied with Signature.getInstance(String, String).
        Parameters:
        algorithm - specified algorithm
        provider - specified provider
        Returns:
        new instance of specified algorithm

      • getInstance

        static GekSign getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm,
                           java.security.Provider provider)
        Returns new instance of specified algorithm and provider. Returned instance has a back thread-local Signature which supplied with Signature.getInstance(String, Provider).
        Parameters:
        algorithm - specified algorithm
        provider - specified provider
        Returns:
        new instance of specified algorithm

      • getSignature

        @Nullable
@Nullable java.security.Signature getSignature()
        Returns back Signature if it has, or null if it doesn't have one. The back Signature maybe thread-local, that is, returned value may be not only one instance.
        Returns:
        back Signature if it has, or null if it doesn't have one

        Prepares for source array.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
